meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

People think you're <vocabulary>dancing</vocabulary>, but you're really jumping from the <reading>mice</reading> (まい) running on your floor. You don't want the mice running up your legs so you have to hop from one to the other, making it look like you're dancing.
